entry.title: Fred J. Wiseman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fred J. Wiseman (pictured) delivered the world's first unofficial airmail flight by airplane?

entry.title: a TV station in North Carolina (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a TV station in North Carolina changed its call letters in memory of its general sales manager, who was shot dead in an incident at its studios?

entry.title: Ashraf Dehghani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that little has been known of the exact whereabouts of Iranian communist leader Ashraf Dehghani since she escaped prison in 1973?

entry.title: Jet Lag: The Game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the contestants on Jet Lag: The Game played a game of capture the flag that spanned the entirety of Japan?

entry.title: Daniel McCaffery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Daniel McCaffery campaigned on protecting abortion rights in the 2023 Pennsylvania Supreme Court election, even though judicial candidates typically avoid commenting on specific issues?

entry.title: an official history (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Chinese government began compiling an official history of the Qing dynasty in 2002, but as of 2023 a protracted political review is forestalling its publication?

entry.title: a Nebraska radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Nebraska radio station chartered an aircraft to search for motorists stranded after a blizzard?

entry.title: Brillante Jr. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the wrestler Brillante Jr. is the younger cousin of the wrestler Brillante Jr.?
